description: Text, colors, sound and even running scripts or applications. It's a great things to have around if you'd like to be reminded of regular tasks, when to get the rubbish to the curb, paydays, meetings (can be set from the calendar!) or even use it as a sort of graphical cron. I love it!
Good integration with the rest of the KDE-PIM suite
Yeah, me too. Don't want akonadi
I love this application! I would recommend it to everyone. Works best under KDE, however, it can also work in Gnome.
Doesn't work, apparently needs to connect to a cloud service, junk
summary: Doesn't work, apparently needs to connect to a cloud service, junk

description: fails to play any sound
Requires Aconadi PIM management service, which is NOT installed together with the package. Also, not necessarily a bad thing, dependencies installed were lots!

Upon launching it says it is trying to run a "Personal information management service". That doesn't sound like any alarm clock program I ever heard of. I wouldn't have installed it if I knew it was going to be trying to collect information on me or my computer.

It failed to run anyway so I uninstalled it.
Annoying!! Had to uninstall!!
summary: Opens every time at login even when disabled in settings etc

description: I get stuck on 91% and cannot remove it after cancelling. Very bad app
I'm removing it immediately after installing

Migrated from Windows 10, and this clock is really bad.
I just want a alarm, and let me decide if it is a sound and or text alarm.
In Windows i tjust works a nd there are more sounds
Here only one simple beep, which even doesn't work. 
App looks a bit 90s like.
Just want a very simple easy with as much as clicks as possible create a egg timer, meetin timer/alarm with sound and text - very simple,
I was afraid that I will not be able to set a regular alarm (indepedently from a specific day), with a customizable sound. I was able to set a regular alarm, with a customizable sound.
summary: Great app, it works as expected, and it offers what I needed

description: I have lots of stuff that I need a timer for. It was complicated for me to figure out, but if determined, it can be done. I need to take certain meds only once every 84 hours, this is really why I figured it out. But I use it for paying bills at the last second, birthdays, vitamins, meds... and I can use audio with it, to insult me into not dragging my butt about getting the deed done. I'm not sure if I like the K stuff otherwise, but I do love this timer... but it's a Pain In the Arse to figure out  Been using it since 2014
summary: Can do some great, Tuff stuff if you're willing to learn it

description: Behaves well with KDE (as expected).

Firstly, this is great for setting simple alarms.
Also, it can set a recurring alarm to run a script - I used it to set rtcwake every day and to play music 1 minute after my computer woke up in the morning.

It's very simple to add exceptions (for holidays etc) to recurring alarms too...

Quite frankly, I can't imagine a better reminder/alarm software.
no me deja hacer nada
No tengo opinión. No funciona.
laberinto para hacer funcionar esto, no va.
summary: requiere engorrosa instalacion de paquetes adicionales no detallados

description: No perdais el tiempo
Requiere demasiados paquetes adicionales para su funcionamiento
summary: No recomendable, debería ser simple para hacer que funcione

description:
Sur le descriptif, on peut lire "Mise à jour : Jamais". Pourquoi mettre à jour et modifier ce qui est simple d'utilisation et, tout simplement, abouti. Je l'utilise depuis......... et même plus longtemps et je n'en changerai pas ;-)
Merci aux développeurs ;-)
При первом запуске не смог определить время (хотя пояс установлен) и не запустился до конца, потребовав запущенную службу личных данных Aakonadi.
Стоит конечно о таком самостоятельно упоминать в описании, а не ждать пока кто-то в комментариях напишет
summary: Нет воспроизведение mp3 и требует сторонее приложение
